Articles.Content:
So, I recently stumbled upon the wiki page of Gas Planet 2. Below, I saw a link to Gas Planet 3. Sounded interesting, but no pic. So here I am, seeing if anyone could try to make a Gas Planet 3 for me. No need to have moons, I just want the planet.

What I want from this GP3:

Really thick atmo

That atmo covers a surface with gravity at 6G

Design, size, all of that is up to you

Not to be confused with the Outer Planets Mod

Thanks!

-SPAddict

Edited October 12, 2015 by SpaceplaneAddict

Outer Planets Mod

Edited May 5, 2021 by Snark
Link to defunct website removed by moderator
^ That. To be quite frank, I wouldn't be surprised if OPM becomes the next stockified mod. (Though hopefully they take it as is with only some cleanups here and there)
So Urlum and Neidon have thick atmo and solid surface?

So Urlum and Neidon have thick atmo and solid surface?
No...

It's meant to be a stockalike representation of the real solar system.
Edited OP with two requirements and a note.

Keelon, the outermost planet in the Kerbol Plus mod, fits the bill. Kerbol Plus is really buggy though. Also the surface gravity is rather lower - more than one planet designer has found that anything above 2.5 g or so causes problems.

Titanus in New Horizons is also similar, and that mod is a lot more stable. You might be able to pull Titanus out and add it to the stock system with a custom config. Titanus's atmosphere has oxygen, unlike Keelon's, so you might like it for a spaceplaning challenge.

Edited October 12, 2015 by cantab

^ That. To be quite frank' date=' I wouldn't be surprised if OPM becomes the next stockified mod. (Though hopefully they take it as is with only some cleanups here and there)[/quote']

I think it has the potential for that but I doubt it will be the NEXT one. I half expect to see something with Rocket Models. Sure, PorkJet and Co. are capable of it, but either Ven's SPR or CCC and FTP are already done.

either Ven's SPR or CCC and FTP are already done.

A bit off-topic, but what are CCC and FTP?
